title: Bug: All connections stopped work after migrate XML to a new Windows System
author: Marsupilani
body_snippet:
I have a huge configfile with a lot of connection (About 300!). This profile works without any problems. 

mRemoteNG Version 1.76 (actual Stable Version)

When I export the profile and import it on a other System (Windwos Server 2016) non of the connections work. 
But when I setup a new connections, this connection inside the profile works, so it seems the application is installed correctly.

iterations.description: Connections are not working after migrating XML to a new Windows system, indicating a critical bug in handling connection file migration or deserialization.

comments.author: robertpopa22
comments.snippet: Triage refresh (P2): this issue has been inactive for a long time. Please retest on the latest build and share reproducible steps, expected vs actual behavior, and logs/screenshots. If there is no confirmation/update, maintainers can close it as stale or not reproducible.

notes:
AI triage (gemini): Connections are not working after migrating XML to a new Windows system, indicating a critical bug in handling connection file migration or deserialization.
Approach: Investigate the XML connection loading, saving, and decryption processes to identify why migrated files are not working on a new system. This may involve examining version compatibility, encryption key handling, or deserialization logic for potential inconsistencies or errors during cross-system migration.
